Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red/brown pottery vessel with slightly ribbed exterior, fabric is black in section, exterior covered with a brown-coloured slip and with remains of at least six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded, and containing an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.147)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87664) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87664)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 184 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
